Why training is required to access the

Training is a mandatory requirement for anyone wishing to access the MakerSpace due to the potential dangers associated with the machines. The maker space is equipped with a range of powerful tools and machinery including 3D printers, lasers, circuit board creators, and milling machines, all of which have the potential to cause harm if not used correctly. Proper training is critical in ensuring the safety of the user and others in the workspace. By providing access to training, individuals can learn how to operate the machinery safely, understand the potential risks, and know how to respond in case of an emergency. Ultimately, the training ensures that the MakerSpace is a safe environment for everyone involved, promoting innovation and creativity in a secure and well-managed environment. Please see available training dates to the right.

Not sure how to use a certain feature of the site? Read below!


Scheduling Information

If you want to schedule a machine in the MakerSpace, head over to "Reserve a Machine" and choose the desired machine and time. You will then be able to see your confirmed reservation in the "Scheduled Reservations" tab. If plans change, feel free to cancel your reservation. Make sure to attend training though prior to reserving a machine! This can be done in person and times are listed just above!

Job Request

If you have a project in mind but aren't quite sure or skilled enough to make it, head over to the "Create Job Request" page and post your project! Be sure to follow the respected format of your name followed by the machine required. Example: "John Snow - 3D Printer" Be sure to include in the description exactly what you want to create and your expected time to e completed. After that, just wait for a student to claim your project and begin working together.

Emergency

In the rare event of an emergency where a machine goes down, someone gets injured, or worse, be sure to use the "EMERGENCY" button at the top. This will send an automated notification to all Admins and Staff. Do not panic! We understand that accidents happen and safety is our number 1 priority!
